channel.title: Running Server From Webhosting
channel.description:
I got everything uploaded and I know the IP to my server, I just cant figure out how to run the batch file from it, I don't know too much about scripting, but I heard if you put:
exec('path/to/bat/file');
In PHP, it should work... but I dont know how to script PHP =-S
So I was wondering if someone could type up the code to the page I would need in order to run the batch file...
My hosting is Linux and is PHP enabled.

item.title: Running Server From Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @DebacleX DebacleX
item.description:
@DebacleX wrote:

I asked them, and they said:

Kirsty: You file path would be IP\file.bat

So basically, mine would look like:

69.65.41.87\runserver.bat

And if I get the PHP file uploaded to the same directory, apparently, I would only need to put:

‘runserver.bat’

But like I siad, I know nothing about this.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server From Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @DePredaTe DePredaTe
item.description:
@DePredaTe wrote:

You would almost have to contact the hosting company. To know the path file to your account would be extremely difficult. I’m not sure if anyone can help you here. Try going to some PHP forums and asking on there.

Read full topic

item.title: Running Server From Webhosting
item.dc:creator: @DebacleX DebacleX
item.description:
@DebacleX wrote:

I got everything uploaded and I know the IP to my server, I just cant figure out how to run the batch file from it, I don’t know too much about scripting, but I heard if you put:

exec(‘path/to/bat/file’);

In PHP, it should work… but I dont know how to script PHP =-S

So I was wondering if someone could type up the code to the page I would need in order to run the batch file…

My hosting is Linux and is PHP enabled.

Read full topic
